Title: The Document Store
DescriptionLines: **The Document Store** is the main Client API object that establishes the communication between your client application and the RavenDB cluster.
It is the single access point to a particular cluster, exposing methods to perform operations against the associated server instances,
holding the configuration, topology, cache and any customizations that you might have applied.
A single instance of a Document Store should be used per the lifetime of the application.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the global Document Store variable
DescriptionLines: * The `globalDocumentStore` variable holds a single instance of the Document Store struct that will be used across your client application.
* In addition to configuring your database & your cluster topology, the Document Store allows access to Client API features such as:
* Session
* Operations
* Bulk Insert
* Changes API
* Data Subscriptions

Walkthroughs.Title: The create Document Store method
DescriptionLines: * Function `createDocumentStore()` returns a configured `ravendb.DocumentStore` object that is used to initialize the _globalDocumentStore_ variable from the previous step.
* If a Document Store object already exists, the existing instance is returned.
Otherwise, a new Document Store instance is created.

Walkthroughs.Title: Instantiate the Document Store
DescriptionLines: * Call `ravendb.NewDocumentStore()` to instantiate a Document Store object.
* Provide the cluster URLs and a default database name.
* _URLs_ - Specify a list of URL addresses pointing to the RavenDB server nodes composing your cluster.
Note: Do not open a DocumentStore using URL addresses that point to nodes outside your cluster.
* _Database_ - Specify the default database name this Document Store will work against.
* Remember to: `Close()` the Document Store object when exiting the client application.

Walkthroughs.Title: Configure client certificate (optional)
DescriptionLines: * Optionally, you can specify the Client Certificate which is used to authenticate the client to the RavenDB server.
* `store.Certificate` => provide a *.pem client certificate ( *.crt + *.key )
* `store.TrustStore` => provide the CA certificate of the client certificate ( *.crt )

Walkthroughs.Title: Configure conventions (optional)
DescriptionLines: * Optionally, you can customize the _Conventions_ for various settings and behaviors.

Walkthroughs.Title: Initialize the Document Store
DescriptionLines: * To be able to work on the DocumentStore, Call `Initialize()` to get the fully initialized Document Store instance.
This will instantiate a communication channel between your application and the RavenDB server instance.

Walkthroughs.Title: Assign to the global Document Store variable
DescriptionLines: * The `globalDocumentStore` variable will hold a reference to the single created instance.
* The rest of your client code can now access the Document Store using the globalDocumentStore for actions such as:
* Opening a Session
* Defining indexes
* Bulk documents actions
* Operations handling
* Subscription tasks management
* Exporting & Importing database data.
